topics.body:
You know; I've been thinking.  Is it just me or is there a metaphorical war on geek culture lately by pseudo geeks?

I know you guys don't want me to drag gamergate into this, but it's only one part of the whole of the drama going on lately on the internet.  There's been a abnormally large amount of shitstorms lately in a lot of fandoms the last couple of months and if I had to summarize all the drama going on it seems be geeks vs hipster pseudo geeks who are just trying to be trendy.  I guess the reason why all this shit started was that hipsters tried to get rid of geek culture and it didn't work out in their favour.
"@Twisty":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54853e5e63687255bb310000#post_54853e5e63687255bb310000
Looks like someone should have bought building insurance.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/548540886368725259820000#post_548540886368725259820000
I consider myself a hipster too. I'm into geek culture, but not as immersed in most of them as many of the real fans. I admire hipster culture. However, I don't condone what the SJWs are doing to these fandoms and great established cultures. It's mostly their social political side I despise. I refuse to be associate with those ravaging dogs.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/548540886368725259820000#post_548540886368725259820000

I really couldn't tell ya. I've stopped paying attention to gaming part of geek culture entirely. I don't think I really like the gaming community as an entity much anymore...so yeah. Not much reason to take a look.

 If we're talking about the comic section. Somewhat. There is a push against the ways of having women as just eye candy or against supposed mysoginy in comics. Which, to be fair, alot of comics are made by men for men and with that a few problems arise as girls start reading them more, so they have reason.  That's the biggest issue there. Well that and a few decisions made by DC and or Marvel.
